subject: Fashion
title: Fashion's Water Footprint
description: A fast breakdown of Fashion's Water Footprint for builders.

hook.text: Making one cotton t-shirt takes about 2,700 liters of waterâ€”what you drink in nearly 3 years.

buildup.text: Cotton is one of the thirstiest crops on Earth, using 2.4% of farmland but 6% of all pesticides.

discovery.text: The Aral Sea, once the world's 4th largest lake, nearly vanished after rivers were drained for cotton.

twist.text: Cotton is just the start. Dyeing and finishing clothes guzzles billions more liters each year.

climax.text: Fashion is the second-largest industrial consumer of water worldwide, right behind food agriculture.

punchline.text: Your wardrobe has a water bill. It's staggering.

quiz.question: Roughly how much water does it take to produce one cotton t-shirt?
